gw.cc.vendormanagement.entity

Interface ServiceRequest


  • public interface ServiceRequest
    ServiceRequest Represents a unit of work requested of a specialist or vendor, including instructions that describe the work to be done and the current state of the ServiceRequest.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String TERMINAL_PROGRESS_FILTER

    • Method Detail

      • anyFieldsChanged

        boolean anyFieldsChanged()
        Returns true if any fields that would be recorded in a ServiceRequestChange have changed on this ServiceRequest in the current bundle.
        Returns:
        true if any fields have changed

      • recordChange

        void recordChange(ServiceRequestChange newChange)
        Sets up sequence and other basic fields on newChange, then adds it to the ServiceRequest, setting it as the latest change. Caller should create a new instance, set the "New"/"Chg" and description fields on it as desired, then pass it to this method. Caller is responsible for ensuring that the "New"/"Chg" fields follow the conventions for these fields, as described in the comments and descriptions for those datamodel fields. In most cases, recordChange(String, ServiceRequestOperation, entity.ServiceRequestStatement, Contact) should be used instead of this method, since it creates the ServiceRequestChange and automatically populates it with the ServiceRequest's changes since the previous service request change.
        Parameters:
        newChange - the ServiceRequestChange to record on this ServiceRequest; must be in the same bundle as this ServiceRequest

      • getLatestChange

        ServiceRequestChange getLatestChange()
        Gets the ServiceRequestChange recording the last change made to the ServiceRequest.
        Returns:
        ServiceRequestChange corresponding to the latest change

      • recordChange

        ServiceRequestChange recordChange(java.lang.String description,
                                  ServiceRequestOperation operation,
                                  ServiceRequestStatement statement,
                                  Contact initiator)
        Creates a ServiceRequestChange based on the changes made to this ServiceRequest in the current bundle. This method looks for property pairs on ServiceRequestChange that follow the "New"/"Chg" naming convention and populates them based on the values from the ServiceRequest.
        Parameters:
        description - a description of this change, to be recorded on the new ServiceRequestChange
        operation - the operation that this change is recording, if any
        statement - service request statement that is related to this change, if any
        initiator - the Contact that initiated the operation
        Returns:
        the new ServiceRequestChange
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no fields have changed, and so no ServiceRequestChange can be recorded

      • linkDocument

        ServiceRequestDocumentLink linkDocument(Document document)
        Link the document to the Service Request using the ServiceRequestDocumentLink join array. The document will not be visible to the specialist.
        Parameters:
        document - to link to the service request; it need not be in the ServiceRequest's bundle
        Returns:
        the ServiceRequestDocumentLink that forms the link

      • linkDocument

        ServiceRequestDocumentLink linkDocument(Document document,
                                        boolean visibleToSpecialist)
        Link the document to the Service Request using the ServiceRequestDocumentLink join array. The visibleToSpecialist
        Parameters:
        document - to link to the service request; it need not be in the ServiceRequest's bundle
        visibleToSpecialist - whether the specialist should have access to the document

      • unlinkDocument

        void unlinkDocument(Document document)
        Unlink the document from the Service Request by removing the entry in the ServiceRequestDocumentLink join array
        Parameters:
        document - to unlink from service request; it need not be in the ServiceRequest's bundle
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified document is

      • getDocuments

        java.util.Collection<Document> getDocuments()
        Return the list of documents linked to the service request
        Returns:
        list of documents linked to the service request

      • getMatchingServiceRequestDocumentLink

        ServiceRequestDocumentLink getMatchingServiceRequestDocumentLink(Document document)
        Return the ServiceRequestDocumentLink on this ServiceRequest that links to the given Document.
        Parameters:
        document - to match
        Returns:
        the matching ServiceRequestDocumentLink

      • getOrderedHistory

        java.util.List<ServiceRequestChange> getOrderedHistory()
        Gets the history of ServiceRequestChanges, ordered by ServiceRequestChange.Sequence, ascending.
        Returns:
        the ServiceRequestChanges for this ServiceRequest, in order

      • copyHistoryAndInstructionsToNewServiceRequest

        void copyHistoryAndInstructionsToNewServiceRequest(ServiceRequest destinationServiceRequest,
                                                   java.util.Map<ServiceRequestQuote,ServiceRequestQuote> quotesMap)
        Copies the ServiceRequestChange history of this Service Request to destinationServiceRequest. destinationServiceRequest must not have any ServiceRequestChange in its history. Note: ServiceRequestInstruction's owned arrays are copied to the destinationServiceRequest. But ServiceRequestChange's owned arrays are not.
        Parameters:
        destinationServiceRequest - service request to copy the history to
        quotesMap - map of originating quotes to promotion service request new quotes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the destinationServiceRequest has a history of changes

      • getPromotionServiceRequests

        java.util.List<ServiceRequest> getPromotionServiceRequests()
        Gets the Service Requests for which OriginatingServiceRequest is equal to this ServiceRequest
        Returns:
        the ServiceRequests that are generated as the result of promoting this ServiceRequest

      • getShortDisplayName

        java.lang.String getShortDisplayName()
        Gets the short display name for the ServiceRequest defined in the entity name
